title: Work Portfolio
text:
Riya Saini
(She/ Her)
Master of City Planning | Transportation Planning
Riya Saini is a student at UPenn focusing on urban mobility. Riya’s expertise includes data-driven solutions and visualization to improve transit efficiency and accessibility across urban regions. Committed to using research and community-focused planning to drive sustainable transportation interventions, Riya is eager to contribute to innovative and equitable transportation initiatives that serve communities of all sizes.



My Projects:


Bus Lane and Transit Signal Prioritization in Philadelphia
This project supports SEPTA’s Bus Revolution network redesign by identifying key streets and intersections in Philadelphia with the highest bus activity and mobility needs. By analyzing ridership patterns, bus performance, and demographic indicators, it aims to enhance service efficiency and equity.


SEPTA Ridership Recovery Post-Covid
This project analyzes SEPTA’s ridership recovery initiative, focusing on the relationship between socioeconomic characteristics, urban infrastructure, and public transit usage in Philadelphia, particularly bus services. In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, SEPTA launched a comprehensive ridership recovery program aimed at restoring full-service levels while ensuring passenger safety.


Shifting Skies: The Rise and Fall of Airlines Since 2013
This analysis explores shifts in air transport since 2013 using FAA Terminal Area Forecast data, identifying trends among major and minor airports. It highlights which airports have grown, stagnated, or declined over time.


Rising Economies of Leisure Airports Post-COVID
This analysis explores how major leisure-focused airports have evolved before and after the COVID-19 pandemic. These airports serve as key hubs for low-cost carriers catering to high-demand tourist routes. The study examines shifts in operations, recovery trends, and changing revenue structures in response to evolving travel patterns.
